DataElement.preferredName: Palliative Radiation Therapy Receive Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow clinical study participation that are related to the receipt of radiation therapy with the intent to relieve symptoms and reduce the suffering caused by the cancer, as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Palliative Radiation Therapy Receive Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any radiation treatment done with the intent to relieve symptoms and reduce the suffering caused by the cancer, and not with the intent of curing the cancer._To take, accept, or get something offered._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any radiation treatment done with the intent to relieve symptoms and reduce the suffering caused by the cancer, and not with the intent of curing the cancer.

Concepts.definition: Any radiation treatment done with the intent to relieve symptoms and reduce the suffering caused by the cancer, and not with the intent of curing the cancer.

Property.preferredDefinition: To take, accept, or get something offered.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: To take, accept, or get something offered.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received palliati
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received palliative radiation to a localized area without residual toxicity within 7 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received palliative radiation for bone metastases less than 2 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received palliative radiation for bone metastases less than 2 weeks prior to prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has received palliative RT (less than 10 fractions), was it completed at least 48 hours prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received palliative radiation therapy to the bone or other sites within 2 weeks of treatment initiation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received palliative radiotherapy for bone metastases less or equal to 2 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received palliative radiation for bone metastases less than 2 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received palliative radiation for bone metastases less than 2 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received or will receive palliative (limited-field) radiation (2 week washout from start of treatment), are the following criteria met: repeat imaging demonstrates no new sites of bone metastases and the lesion being considered for palliative radiation is not a target lesion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had radiotherapy to the chest within 4 weeks or non-abdominal palliative stereotactic radiation therapy within 2 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has received palliative bone RT (less than 10 fractions), was it completed at least 48 hours prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received palliative radiation to a localized area without residual toxicity within 7 days prior to entering study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received palliative radiation therapy less than 1 week?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was any palliative radiation therapy completed greater than or equal to 1 week prior to start of protocol therapy?Â

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received palliative (limited-field) radiation therapy, have all the following criteria been met:  repeat imaging demonstrates no new sites of bone metastases, and the lesion being considered for palliative radiation is not a target lesion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior palliative radiotherapy within 14 days of Cycle 1 Day 1 and prior definitive radiotherapy within 42 days of Cycle 1 Day 1?
